content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I have played it and it works well for a clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: clear and simple, Cool !
Additionally some programming languages don't cope well with accented letters; fortunately none of your test cases have accented letters in the expected result :-)
I think this one is suitable also for reverse and shortest mode.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Hey you know what, i won't bother with a matter of ECMA or ES behaviours

It is good to go for me ;)

Hello,

Nice challenge, perfect for a clash.
Validator are similar to Tests cases which is good.

As you parsed your test cases by difficulties, why adding a double space in test case 1 while having test case 3 anb 4 dedicated to parsing ? (ie: The Fighting Temptations[space][space](5.6/10))

Following MDN documention on Array.prototype.sort() 

If compareFunction(a, b) returns 0, leave a and b unchanged with respect to each other, but sorted with respect to all different elements. Note: the ECMAscript standard does not guarantee this behavior, thus, not all browsers (e.g. Mozilla versions dating back to at least 2003) respect this.

I think your solution shouldn't rely on the fast that with equals rating, native order will not be altered.
You should implement it to ensure the native order is well kept while rating are equals.

Once this few update done, it is good to go for me ;)

If you have any questions or corrections feel free to comment !
Sorry for my bad english

I moved the double space in the title parsing test ;)

As of ES2019, Array#sort is stable, so two entries with the same value don't change position relative to original.

I think it's ok

Thanks for comment !

I think i can add the shortest mode but for a reverse i can't provide the constraint of keep order if two movie have same rating

Hi ! Thanks for your share!

I have mixed a little more the playtest ;)

Thanks for this tip ;) 

I have removed accents for not affraid some peoples about this case ^^
That constraint is in the test "Check title parsing + order". Maybe you could add another similar test with different movies to ensure that it is not in alphabetical order.
Ok, i have add one more movie with the same rating in the title parsing test and enable reverse mode ;)
